item.title: TOMORROW - Join us for a car protest demanding urgently needed...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

TOMORROW - Join us for a car protest demanding urgently needed rent & mortgage cancellation!

Children are starving, tens of millions face eviction, huge swaths of the population are struggling to make ends meet. It doesn't have to be this way! We need to fight back to demand real relief from the government!

item.title: PAUSE & READ THESE STATS: Nearly 200,000 people in Colorado...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

PAUSE & READ THESE STATS: Nearly 200,000 people in Colorado are not caught up on rent. 15% of children in the state are not eating enough because their family can’t afford it. 52% of Black adults and 50% of Latino adults in the country are struggling to make ends meet.

The suffering working people are experiencing right now is absolutely staggering. The government’s decision to give nothing but a $600 check to address a crisis of this magnitude is a decision to let this conti...nue, to force families to choose between paying rent or eating. This is unacceptable. We have to fight back!

PSL has been out nearly every day for weeks knocking on doors across the city talking to people about building community power and fighting for rent cancelation.

✊ Join the community car protest this Sunday to demand:
1) Cancel rents & mortgages!
2) No evictions!
3) No foreclosures!
4) Full housing rights for people who are undocumented!
5) Housing for the homeless!

See More+2

item.title: Even though 8 of Colorado's 10 largest active outbreaks are...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Even though 8 of Colorado's 10 largest active outbreaks are in jails and prisons, Colorado officials have decided that incarcerated people, who are mostly poor people of color, should be at the very back of the line for vaccinations. In a press conference, Gov. Jared Polis, one of the richest men in America, laughed at the idea of prioritizing prisoners.

Prisoners are at a higher risk of catching COVID-19 and dying or suffering serious symptoms. They cannot socially distance ...and they must share bathrooms and sleeping spaces. Systemic poverty and racism mean they have often had poor or nonexistent health care their entire lives and several underlying conditions.

The U.S. has by far the largest incarcerated population in the world, 2.3 million people. Massive overcrowding, squalid conditions, and rampant abuse have long been the norm in prisons and jails across the country. Instead of seriously pursuing early release, reduced admissions, and other obviously necessary reforms during the pandemic, politicians and prison officials have deliberately allowed conditions to become even worse.

It is clear the prison system under U.S. capitalism is not a tool for "rehabilitation", but for social control of poor and oppressed people, especially communities suffering under the boot of white supremacy.

From the article:

"A combination of extended lockdowns, short staffing and rising anxiety about COVID-19 has created a situation in Colorado’s prisons that the director of the state’s prisons called “tenuous” and that has outraged inmates’ families.

Prisoners are fed substandard meals — sometimes as little as two slices of bread, a piece of bologna, and an apple — and sometimes are not able to access showers for days at a time, eight families and a former guard said. Staffing is stretched thin as guards fall ill and hundreds are placed on leave on a given day. Some inmates go weeks without stepping outside.

“He just feels so less than human,” said Krystal Griffiths, whose fiancé is incarcerated at the Buena Vista prison."

Read more: https://www.denverpost.com/…/colorado-prisons-coronavirus-…/

See MorePrisoners are being fed substandard meals — sometimes as little as two slices of bread, a piece of bologna, and an apple — and sometimes are not able to access showers for days at a tim…

denverpost.com

Staff shortages, extended lockdowns in coronavirus-ridden Colorado prisons create “tenuous” situations

Prisoners are being fed substandard meals — sometimes as little as two slices of bread, a piece of bologna, and an apple — and sometimes are not able to access showers for days at a tim…Prisoners are being fed substandard meals — sometimes as little as two slices of bread, a piece of bologna, and an apple — and sometimes are not able to access showers for days at a tim…

item.title: This is the second part of the interview that PSL Denver...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

This is the second part of the interview that PSL Denver organizer Lillian did with LookLeft, the newspaper of the Workers Party of Ireland. This interview is essential reading, as it discusses our response to the recent election, the growing interest in socialism in the US, our approach to the trade union movement, and more. Part one focuses on the political prosecution and charges that Lillian and others are facing, read it here: https://www.lookleft.ie/…/the-price-of-prote...sting-the-poli…/

"There is a tendency in US politics for the progressive sectors to diminish their militancy and focussed organising when Democrats take control of the white house. Some fear that organising against a Democratic administration strengthens the Right and the Republicans, and these parts of the US Left begin to either self-censor or to act as if they are simply a friendly lobby that acts for the Democratic Party to make this or that concession.

This is a fundamental weakness in US left politics. Right now there needs to be an intensifying political class struggle to fight back against the capitalist government which continues to function as a servant for Wall Street and the military industrial complex. There should be no “honeymoon period” for the Biden administration. It is an aggressive, imperialist, and anti-worker government, and even if Biden were to nominate a few liberals to sprinkle around in his cabinets, we would not change our characterisation of his administration one iota.

The biggest, looming issues in America are the crisis in housing, massive unemployment, and growing hunger. The stock exchange is breaking records because both ruling class parties are rewarding the capitalists with huge cash infusions and loan guarantees, but tens of millions of workers are facing absolute and utter ruin. Millions are literally in line waiting for food handouts, and we believe this crisis is going to grow.

The PSL intends to focus on the section of the population, again numbering in the tens of millions, who are in absolute existential crisis and for whom the capitalist system has turned into nothing more than a nightmare."

https://www.lookleft.ie/…/the-struggle-doesnt-end-when-tru…/

See More"The PSL understands that the state apparatus is a permanent state, not something that changes every four years. In the past few years, people have mistakenly used the labelling of this permanent state as 'the deep state.' We prefer to just call it the capitalist state."

lookleft.ie

The struggle doesn't end when Trump leaves office

"The PSL understands that the state apparatus is a permanent state, not something that changes every four years. In the past few years, people have mistakenly used the labelling of this permanent state as 'the deep state.' We prefer to just call it the capitalist state.""The PSL understands that the state apparatus is a permanent state, not something that changes every four years. In the past few years, people have mistakenly used the labelling of this permanent state as 'the deep state.' We prefer to just call it the capitalist state."

item.title: While Denver teachers and other city employees take paycuts and...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

While Denver teachers and other city employees take paycuts and furlough days, while the people of Denver just spent months in protest calling on the city to defund the police, City Council just approved raises for Denver police. “Reluctant” or not, this just goes to show that our supposed democratic institutions do not serve to meet the people’s needs; they serve to maintain the status quo.

The agreement — approved on a 10-3 margin — came from an arbitrator after council denied the originally proposed contract in September.

denverpost.com

Reluctantly, Denver City Council approve raises for police officers

The agreement — approved on a 10-3 margin — came from an arbitrator after council denied the originally proposed contract in September.The agreement — approved on a 10-3 margin — came from an arbitrator after council denied the originally proposed contract in September.
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Today PSL, Restaurant Workers United, and DSA sent members to...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Today PSL, Restaurant Workers United, and DSA sent members to protest Mark Shaker, owner of the Stanley Marketplace, who fired a worker for bringing up COVID safety concerns in his business. Elizabeth McIntire, former hairstylist at Clementine’s, a salon within the Marketplace, voiced concerns to the building owner about the lack of social distancing and number of people allowed to gather inside the Stanley at various events that have occurred during the COVID-19 pandemic. Sh...e was met with immediate hostility, and was banned from the building, and later, fired from her job.

Today members of the above organizations gathered to spread awareness to community and patrons of the marketplace of this injustice through flyering and with signs.

We were immediately met with a police force that told us we must stay off Mark Shaker’s private property! But that didn’t stop us from gaining support and attention from the nearby residents and patrons by flyering to the cars and people walking on the nearby sidewalk!

If one worker is fired for voicing safety concerns any worker could face the same consequences when they voice concerns. Workers should not live in fear of speaking up to protect themselves, especially during a pandemic that has killed hundreds of thousands of people in the U.S.

AN INJURY TO ONE IS AN INJURY TO ALL!

Stop Mark Shaker's silencing of worker’s safety concerns!

See More+4
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Part 1/2 of the PSL’s Lillian House’s interview with the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Part 1/2 of the PSL’s Lillian House’s interview with the Workers Party of Ireland

"The Party for Socialism and Liberation is one of the fastest growing socialist organisations in the US. In recent months, its members have been central in the struggles against police brutality and injustice. Earlier this year, four activists, including three members of the PSL, were arrested in Denver, Colorado for their role in protesting the police murder of Elijah McCain.

LookLeft spoke to Lillian House a PSL organiser in Denver and one of the PSL members arrested for her involvement in the protests, about her arrest, the massive protests that have taken place over the last year, and the broader political situation in the United States"

Activists from one of the fastest growing socialist organisations in the US were arrested in Denver, Colorado for their role in protesting the police murder of Elijah McCain.

lookleft.ie

The Price of Protesting the Police

Activists from one of the fastest growing socialist organisations in the US were arrested in Denver, Colorado for their role in protesting the police murder of Elijah McCain.Activists from one of the fastest growing socialist organisations in the US were arrested in Denver, Colorado for their role in protesting the police murder of Elijah McCain.

item.title: Tune in tomorrow for analysis of the critically important...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Tune in tomorrow for analysis of the critically important December 6 elections and the continuing fight against U.S. attempts to crush the Bolivarian Revolution. The outcome of this struggle is of immense importance to the people of Venezuela and all Latin America.

The livestream will feature speakers who have been on the ground in Venezuela during the elections including:
Gloria La Riva, Party for Socialism & Liberation 2020 presidential candidate
Manolo de los Santos, International People’s Assembly Kei Pritsker, Breakthrough News.

SAT, DEC 12

item.title: A major eviction crisis is on the way. Over half a million...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

A major eviction crisis is on the way. Over half a million Coloradans—16% of the population—are at risk of eviction when the current moratoriums expire. If we can’t pay rent now, how will we come up with the money when all that back rent comes through?

Temporary eviction bans are not enough! That’s why PSL is in neighborhoods across Denver and Aurora talking to the community about building the struggle for rent and mortgage cancellation.

Join a community car protest December 27 before January rent comes due to call attention to this urgent demand! ➡Cancel the Rents! Denver-Aurora Car Protest
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: More than 8 million people in the country were unable to pay...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

More than 8 million people in the country were unable to pay last month’s rent. Come December 31, an estimated 520,000 Coloradans—16% of Colorado’s population—may be facing eviction, when the moratoriums expire.

We need to fight back and demand that Governor Polis cancel rent and mortgages now! Temporary bans are not enough!

Join us for a community car protest on December 27, before rent is due on January 1, to drive through town calling attention to the urgent need for rent... and mortgage cancellation! Cancel the Rents! Denver-Aurora Car Protest

#CanceltheRents #CancelRentPolis

See More

item.title: Did you know an estimated 30–40 million people in the US could...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Did you know an estimated 30–40 million people in the US could be at risk of eviction in the coming months, and hundreds of thousands in Colorado? That’s why PSL members are hitting the ground across Denver and Aurora to talk to the community about building the struggle for rent cancellation.

The patchwork of temporary eviction moratoriums is not enough to address the colossal crisis facing the people of this country. When they expire and rent comes due, millions of people will suddenly be out on the street. The people need rent and mortgage cancellation now—nothing less! #CanceltheRents

+2
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: It’s almost 1, and the Aurora Civil Service Commission meeting...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

It’s almost 1, and the Aurora Civil Service Commission meeting is beginning soon. Get ready to call in!

Beginning next week, the Commission will begin private hearings to decide whether to overturn the firing of APD officers Erica Marrero, Kyle Dittrich, and Jason Rosenblatt.

Marrero and Dittrich, pictured left, took photos mocking Elijah McClain’s death at his memorial site and sent them to the cops who tortured and killed Elijah, Nathan Woodyard and Jason Rosenblatt.

...

Rosenblatt wrote back “haha” and was caught. He was fired for this incident and remains the only one of Elijah’s killers who lost his job.

These cops have demonstrated that they have absolutely no business patrolling our streets, armed, with the ability to decide if people like Elijah live or die. We demand that they are NOT reinstated!

Tune in to our stories for live updates during the meeting!

#justiceforelijahmcclain

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: “On December 2, Governor Jared Polis released the second...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“On December 2, Governor Jared Polis released the second revision of his executive order calling for a state investigation into the death of Elijah McClain. But activists are impatient for more than words. “We are not settling for symbolism,” says Lillian House, a prominent organizer with the Denver chapter of the Party for Socialism and Liberation who is facing serious felony charges over demonstrations this summer demanding justice for Elijah McClain.

“People in the street...s do move people in power,” House says regarding this new version of the order, then adds: “At this point, it is nothing more than a symbolic gesture."

Keep up the fight! ➡️➡️ Today at 1pm we are holding a call-in to the Aurora Civil Service Commission which will be hearing appeals for the reinstatement of APD officers fired for photos mocking Elijah’s death. https://fb.me/e/5NauFxUtB

See MoreGovernor Polis has clarified his executive order.

westword.com

Activists Want More Than Symbolism From Elijah McClain Investigation

Governor Polis has clarified his executive order.Governor Polis has clarified his executive order.

item.title: DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER AREA! - HOW YOU CAN HELP

On Sept. 17, police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-racist organizers in a coordinated assault. People were arrested in a Home Depot parking lot, at their homes, and after they were pulled over while driving. Those arrested were the leaders to demand justice for Elijah McClain, who was brutally murdered by the Aurora Police Department. They are still in jail, with the exception of ...one person. They are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain.

Add your name to sign the petition and join the campaign to demand that all the charges be dropped!

Petition text:

"I demand that all charges be dropped on anti-racist organizers in the Denver area. It is an obvious political frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain."

You can also donate for legal and political support for the PSL organizers who were arrested: pslweb.org/donate4denver

If you are a community leader or a member of an organization you can sign our solidarity statement: pslweb.org/denverorgsolidarity

If you can support in person, you can join our emergency demonstration demanding the dropping off all charges: https://facebook.com/events/s/dropthechargesco-march-and-ral/775179416359489/?ti=icl
